data.title: If It Doesn’t Have Multiple Vanessa Hudgenses In It, I Refuse To Watch!
data.meta_description: I long for a simpler time, a time when I could enjoy a movie without multiple Vanessa Hudgenses in it. All my life I was coasting along, not realizing that what was missing from every viewing…
data.text:
I long for a simpler time, a time when I could enjoy a movie without multiple Vanessa Hudgenses in it. All my life I was coasting along, not realizing that what was missing from every viewing experience was a land called Hudgegravia or Vanessovia overflowing with Vanessa Hudgenses! Netflix came along and cracked the code of what great cinema should have always been, and I was forever Switched.

Now, I immediately turn off every movie unless I see at least TWO Vanessa Hudgenses in it within the first 15 minutes. One Vanessa just doesn’t cut it these days! You may think fifteen minutes isn’t a very long time, but if you have ANY Vanessa Hudgenses, you better show them IMMEDIATELY! For some viewers, it has been their ONLY CRITERIA since 2018.

I’ve started hundreds of movies only to be infuriated when I did not see a minimum of two Hudges in those first 900 seconds. Tick Tick Boom got my hopes up, but Netflix dropped the ball and only put one Vanessa Hudgens in there. And why are they the only streaming service to utilize the magic of the Hudge multi-verse? You can’t copyright having multiple Vanessa Hudgenses in a movie, TV…
